definition: to be in charge in one's own house (idiom)/to be the master of one's own affairs
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: The people are the masters of their country.
It is the striking theme of the ruling history and country history that people are the masters.
sentences.chinese: 人民當家作主成爲黨的執政史和國史的鮮明主題。

sentences.english: Some people prosper before others. The basis of socialism is public ownership of means of production.
sentences.chinese: 社會主義的基礎是公有制，人民當家作主，共同致富。

sentences.english: Then you may not choose Bhutanese women, these women dominate the family.
sentences.chinese: 那麼你不要選不丹的女人，這些女人當家作主。

sentences.english: It is the Libyan people who is responsible for administering power.
sentences.chinese: 利比亞是由人民當家作主的國家。
